content:
Hi All,
I want all the v2 version of messages.Is there any generated files of v2 is there or any tools to generate the HL7 V2 messages for conversion purpose
Thank You,
look for the v2 access database on the HL7 website
Has anyone processed those into FHIR Logical models?
yes i have. Will be making this available once R4 is published

yes i have. Will be making this available once R4 is published

Hi @Grahame Grieve - can you share the url to this published models? Thank you.

yes i have. Will be making this available once R4 is published

Hi @Grahame Grieve - can you share the url to this published models? Thank you.

Hi @Grahame Grieve - url to that published models please. Thanks

look for the v2 access database on the HL7 website

Is there a free version of this v2 Access DB ?

The InM committee used to have a DB for use in generating Conformance (XML) stuff I believe; not sure if it was freely available or not. Trying to remember the person who was the InM committee chair for a number of years --- he would know.
ask frank@oemig.de
(or @Frank Oemig )
I don't believe it was freely available for many years, except for internal use for committee business
Yep, Frank is the guy I remember who had the HL7 V2 DB for conformance profiling and XML V2 generation
Since the opening of the availability of standards materials, should that now be a different answer @Grahame Grieve ?
I don't think that one is different. Nor am I sure whether it should be
this is relevant to this thread: https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/181579-mapping-framework/topic/StructureMap

the comprehensive v2 Access database contains all information about all v2.x versions (2.1 - 2.8.2). It allows for generating xml schemas, websites (hl7.eu/refactored/hl7.html), FHIR structure definitions, etc. I haven't added generation of example messages yet.

the comprehensive v2 Access database contains all information about all v2.x versions (2.1 - 2.8.2). It allows for generating xml schemas, websites (hl7.eu/refactored/hl7.html), FHIR structure definitions, etc. I haven't added generation of example messages yet.

Thank you all. @Frank Oemig - like FHIR examples, any possibility of getting v2 Access db for free download. I am a HL7 member, and not sure if HL7 supports that. I am also interested in such examples for v3, CDA and CCDA.

Largely for historic and contractual reasons the v2 access database isn't a free for use product, not for members or anyone else. I did request the HL7 BoD to free it up a couple of years ago, but to no avail, v2 was/is still dealt with differently than FHIR when it comes to this. Computable specifications of the other standards are readily available, although not always in an easy to use format.
If it's just about the bare bones v2 definitions you could have a look at some of the open source HL7 v2 tools out there, they also contain the v2 message definitions - however, you may be infringing on their work, and it won't be the official source of truth.

Is it possible to use the v2.xml from the HL7.org website for this purpose @Nilesh Pagare ? @René Spronk - does v2.xml have the same 'licensing restrictions' as the V2 Access DB or can it be freely used?

http://www.hl7.org/documentcenter/public_temp_D5415C21-1C23-BA17-0CD313DF6BE601D7/wg/xml/drafts/v2xml.html

Here is a link with more up to date schemas @John Silva . http://www.hl7.org/implement/standards/product_brief.cfm?product_id=213. If you download the "Version 2.5 and earlier" version there is a reference to Sun having built them off of the Access database, so you may still need to feel out the licensing restrictions. I believe that the versions after 2.5 are subject to the default HL7 IP policy.

HL7 standards and related artefacts are licensed to individuals for free use, but there is no license approval for those individuals to share any derived artefacts with each other. Most of the open source libraries are in violation of this license, and I don't know how that tension will be resolved.

This doesn't apply to FHIR artefacts, which have always and only been licensed under Creative Commons Domain (the derived software is mostly licensed under BSD or Apache)
How to resolve this? Use a new open licensing scheme for all HL7 standards. Simple, right ? ;-)
yes. simple. But the opposite of easy

Sounds like something that needs to be raised to the HL7 board. In these days of open source software and standards, these kind of impediments hold back interoperability. It's great that FHIR has, from the start, has a more "open" licensing model but the reality (the 'real world') still has many (mostly?) HL7 V2 interfaces and if we want to bring them into the FHIR world, we need to remove this licensing hurdle (IMHO).
sure but be aware that there are a number of people at HL7 who are strongly opposed to open source, and so a change like this will have strong push-back
It sure ain't gonna happen if we don't try, try, and try again... ;-)

It sure ain't gonna happen if we don't try, try, and try again... ;-)

@René Spronk , @Grahame Grieve , @Nick Hatt and @John Silva - so as of now the v2 xml and v2 access store is still not free to use. Is that correct ?
@Nilesh Pagare Correct.
I believe that's not quite correct: v2.xml is free to use, but not to share derived artefacts. v2 access database is not free in either sense
@Nilesh Pagare it also depends on what you actually want to do with your product. http://www.hl7.org/legal/ippolicy.cfm the HL7 IP Policy lets you do more if you join as an organizational member.

Nilesh Pagare it also depends on what you actually want to do with your product. http://www.hl7.org/legal/ippolicy.cfm the HL7 IP Policy lets you do more if you join as an organizational member.

Hi @Nick Hatt , I am a member of HL7 org.

There are V2 StructureDefinitions here: http://hl7.eu/refactored/msgADT_A01.html
But they aren't Logical Models. What are they!?

I assume, those have nothing to do with
@Brian Postlethwaite

Has anyone processed those into FHIR Logical models?

@Grahame Grieve

yes i have. Will be making this available once R4 is published

?
@Grahame Grieve : can you give us a rough estimate on the ETA for the V2 LogicalModels?
hmm. I will try and dig them up today
